metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2208 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
NULL Pointer Dereference in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.5163.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-athena - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-gtk - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-gui-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-nox - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-runtime - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
vim-tiny - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
xxd - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16
No subscription required

notes.Note: eslerm> requires, at least, backporting 7528d1f for need_diff_redraw

criterions.comment: vim package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.16').
